member.summary: Gets the DPI scale on the X axis.When DPI is 96, is 1.
member.remarks: On Windows Desktop, this value is the same as

member.summary: Gets the DPI scale on the Y axis. When DPI is 96, is 1.
member.remarks: On Windows Desktop, this value is the same as

member.summary: Get or sets the PixelsPerDip at which the text should be rendered.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Equality test
member.returns: True if the objects are equal, False otherwise

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code of the current object
member.returns: The hash code of the object

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale.Equals(SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale)
member.summary: Equality test against a object.
member.returns: True if the objects are equal, False otherwise
member.remarks:
Two DPI scale values are equal if they are equal after rounding up to hundredths place.
Common PPI values in use are:
PPIDPI(%)DPI(Ratio)
96100%1.00
120125%1.25
144150%1.50
192200%2.00

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale.op_Inequality(SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale,SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale)
member.summary: Checks to inequality between two instances.
member.returns: True if the objects are not equal, otherwise False

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale.op_Equality(SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale,SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiScale)
member.summary: Checks for equality between two instances.
member.returns: True if the two objects are equal, otherwise False

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.DefaultPixelsPerInch
member.summary: This is the default PPI value used in WPF and Windows.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetWindowScale(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Gets the window (monitor) scale versus System DPI.

remarks.para: When developing a DPI-aware application, this is useful for applying a ScaleTransform to your window so all fonts and graphics are scaled and rendered beautifully based on the physical capabilities of the display and the accessibility settings of the user.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetWindowScale(System.Windows.Media.Visual)
member.summary: Gets the window (monitor) scale versus System DPI.

remarks.para: When developing a DPI-aware application, this is useful for applying a ScaleTransform to your window so all fonts and graphics are scaled and rendered beautifully based on the physical capabilities of the display and the accessibility settings of the user.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetWindowScale(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the window (monitor) scale versus System DPI.

remarks.para: When developing a DPI-aware application, this is useful for applying a ScaleTransform to your window so all fonts and graphics are scaled and rendered beautifully based on the physical capabilities of the display and the accessibility settings of the user.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetVirtualPixelScale(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Gets the virtual pixel scale for a window. This is essentially the Effective DPI of the monitor versus a standard 96 DPI.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetVirtualPixelScale(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the virtual pixel scale for a window. This is essentially the Effective DPI of the monitor versus a standard 96 DPI.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetVirtualPixelScaleByMonitor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the virtual pixel scale for a monitor. This is essentially the Effective DPI of the monitor versus a standard 96 DPI.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetMonitorEffectiveDpi(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Get the Effective DPI of a monitor after a user's accessibility preferences have been applied.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetSystemEffectiveDpi(System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Get the System Effective DPI.

remarks.para: The System Effective DPI is derived by the operating system by looking across all monitors and determining an "Effective DPI" that works well across all the screens for applications that do not support per-monitor DPI.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetWindowEffectiveDpi(System.Windows.Window,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Get the Effective DPI of a windows (monitor) after a user's accessibility preferences have been applied.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetWindowEffectiveDpi(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32@,System.UInt32@)
member.summary: Get the Effective DPI of a windows (monitor) after a user's accessibility preferences have been applied.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.DpiUtilities.GetScreenScalingFactor(System.String)
member.summary: Gets scaling factor for a monitor This is defined as current pixel size relative to effective DPI
member.param: Monitor device name or null for the primary monitor

member.name: T:SharpVectors.Runtime.SvgImageNameScope
member.summary: This class, if placed at the root of a XAML file which is loaded by XamlReader.Load() will end up having all named elements contained in its nameTable automatically. If you want to get that list, it is now in your power.
member.remarks: This class is based on the discussion, which can be found here

summary.para: A value specifying the type of interactivity to be supported by the conversion process and controls.
In the conversion process, more information are added to make the interactivity defined possible, and might be unnecessary overhead where no interactivity is needed.
In the rendering process at the control level, keyboard and mouse operations are monitored to support interactivities.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.SvgInteractiveModes.None
member.summary: A value specifying no interactivity.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.SvgInteractiveModes.Standard
member.summary: A value specifying the default or standard interactivity per the SVG specifications.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.SvgInteractiveModes.Advanced
member.summary: A value specifying extra or custom interactivity features.

member.name: T:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl
member.summary: A class that wraps up zooming and panning of it's content.

This is an extension to the ZoomPanControl class that implements the IScrollInfo interface properties and functions.
IScrollInfo is implemented to allow ZoomPanControl to be wrapped (in XAML) in a ScrollViewer. IScrollInfo allows the ScrollViewer and ZoomPanControl to communicate important information such as the horizontal and vertical scrollbar offsets.
There is a good series of articles showing how to implement IScrollInfo starting here: http://blogs.msdn.com/bencon/archive/2006/01/05/509991.aspx

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._content
member.summary: Reference to the underlying content, which is named PART_Content in the template.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._contentScaleTransform
member.summary: The transform that is applied to the content to scale it by 'ContentScale'.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._contentOffsetTransform
member.summary: The transform that is applied to the content to offset it by 'ContentOffsetX' and 'ContentOffsetY'.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._enableContentOffsetUpdateFromScale
member.summary: Enable the update of the content offset as the content scale changes. This enabled for zooming about a point (Google-maps style zooming) and zooming to a rect.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._disableScrollOffsetSync
member.summary: Used to disable synchronization between IScrollInfo interface and ContentOffsetX/ContentOffsetY.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._disableContentFocusSync
member.summary: Normally when content offsets changes the content focus is automatically updated. This synchronization is disabled when 'disableContentFocusSync' is set to 'true'. When we are zooming in or out we 'disableContentFocusSync' is set to 'true' because we are zooming in or out relative to the content focus we don't want to update the focus.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._constrainedContentViewportWidth
member.summary: The width of the viewport in content coordinates, clamped to the width of the content.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._constrainedContentViewportHeight
member.summary: The height of the viewport in content coordinates, clamped to the height of the content.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._canVerticallyScroll
member.summary: Set to 'true' when the vertical scrollbar is enabled.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._canHorizontallyScroll
member.summary: Set to 'true' when the vertical scrollbar is enabled.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._unScaledExtent
member.summary: Records the unscaled extent of the content. This is calculated during the measure and arrange.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._viewport
member.summary: Records the size of the viewport (in viewport coordinates) onto the content. This is calculated during the measure and arrange.

member.name: F:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl._scrollOwner
member.summary: Reference to the ScrollViewer that is wrapped (in XAML) around the ZoomPanControl. Or set to null if there is no ScrollViewer.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.#cctor
member.summary: Static constructor to define metadata for the control (and link it to the style in Generic.xaml).

member.summary: Event raised when the ContentOffsetX property has changed.

member.name: E:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentOffsetYChanged
member.summary: Event raised when the ContentOffsetY property has changed.

member.name: E:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentScaleChanged
member.summary: Event raised when the ContentScale property has changed.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentOffsetX
member.summary: Get/set the X offset (in content coordinates) of the view on the content.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentOffsetY
member.summary: Get/set the Y offset (in content coordinates) of the view on the content.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentScale
member.summary: Get/set the current scale (or zoom factor) of the content.

member.summary: Get/set the minimum value for 'ContentScale'.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MaxContentScale
member.summary: Get/set the maximum value for 'ContentScale'.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentZoomFocusX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the content focus, this is the point that we are focusing on when zooming.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentZoomFocusY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the content focus, this is the point that we are focusing on when zooming.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ViewportZoomFocusX
member.summary: The X coordinate of the viewport focus, this is the point in the viewport (in viewport coordinates) that the content focus point is locked to while zooming in.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ViewportZoomFocusY
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the viewport focus, this is the point in the viewport (in viewport coordinates) that the content focus point is locked to while zooming in.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.AnimationDuration
member.summary: The duration of the animations (in seconds) started by calling AnimatedZoomTo and the other animation methods.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentViewportWidth
member.summary: Get the viewport width, in content coordinates.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ContentViewportHeight
member.summary: Get the viewport height, in content coordinates.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.IsMouseWheelScrollingEnabled
member.summary: Set to 'true' to enable the mouse wheel to scroll the zoom and pan control. This is set to 'false' by default.

member.summary: Do an animated zoom to view a specific scale and rectangle (in content coordinates).

member.summary: Do an animated zoom to the specified rectangle (in content coordinates).

member.summary: Instantly zoom to the specified rectangle (in content coordinates).

member.summary: Instantly center the view on the specified point (in content coordinates).

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ZoomAboutPoint(System.Double,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Zoom in/out centered on the specified point (in content coordinates). The focus point is kept locked to it's on screen position (ala google maps).

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ZoomTo(System.Double)
member.summary: Zoom in/out centered on the viewport center.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ResetViewportZoomFocus
member.summary: Reset the viewport zoom focus to the center of the viewport.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateViewportSize(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Update the viewport size from the specified size.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateContentViewportSize
member.summary: Update the size of the viewport in content coordinates after the viewport size or 'ContentScale' has changed.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateTranslationX
member.summary: Update the X coordinate of the translation transformation.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateTranslationY
member.summary: Update the Y coordinate of the translation transformation.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateContentZoomFocusX
member.summary: Update the X coordinate of the zoom focus point in content coordinates.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.UpdateContentZoomFocusY
member.summary: Update the Y coordinate of the zoom focus point in content coordinates.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.CanVerticallyScroll
member.summary: Set to 'true' when the vertical scrollbar is enabled.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.CanHorizontallyScroll
member.summary: Set to 'true' when the vertical scrollbar is enabled.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ExtentWidth
member.summary: The width of the content (with 'ContentScale' applied).

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ExtentHeight
member.summary: The height of the content (with 'ContentScale' applied).

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ViewportWidth
member.summary: Get the width of the viewport onto the content.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ViewportHeight
member.summary: Get the height of the viewport onto the content.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.ScrollOwner
member.summary: Reference to the ScrollViewer that is wrapped (in XAML) around the ZoomPanControl. Or set to null if there is no ScrollViewer.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.HorizontalOffset
member.summary: The offset of the horizontal scrollbar.

member.name: P:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.VerticalOffset
member.summary: The offset of the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.SetHorizontalOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Called when the offset of the horizontal scrollbar has been set.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.SetVerticalOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Called when the offset of the vertical scrollbar has been set.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.LineUp
member.summary: Shift the content offset one line up.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.LineDown
member.summary: Shift the content offset one line down.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.LineLeft
member.summary: Shift the content offset one line left.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.LineRight
member.summary: Shift the content offset one line right.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.PageUp
member.summary: Shift the content offset one page up.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.PageDown
member.summary: Shift the content offset one page down.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.PageLeft
member.summary: Shift the content offset one page left.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.PageRight
member.summary: Shift the content offset one page right.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MouseWheelDown
member.summary: Don't handle mouse wheel input from the ScrollViewer, the mouse wheel is used for zooming in and out, not for manipulating the scrollbars.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MouseWheelLeft
member.summary: Don't handle mouse wheel input from the ScrollViewer, the mouse wheel is used for zooming in and out, not for manipulating the scrollbars.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MouseWheelRight
member.summary: Don't handle mouse wheel input from the ScrollViewer, the mouse wheel is used for zooming in and out, not for manipulating the scrollbars.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MouseWheelUp
member.summary: Don't handle mouse wheel input from the ScrollViewer, the mouse wheel is used for zooming in and out, not for manipulating the scrollbars.

member.name: M:SharpVectors.Runtime.ZoomPanControl.MakeVisible(System.Windows.Media.Visual,System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Bring the specified rectangle to view.
